name: Tihama Restaurant Bronx
address: 600 Van Nest Ave, Bronx, NY 10460, USA

reviews.text: Very good service, waiters and waitresses are very nice, respectful, and patient. Food is very good and a great place to expand your taste pallet! Definitely a recommendation for all. Gave us free tea and soup samples!!!!

Good food .
Scams on prices always charging extra

Nice people the rice exquisite the chicken is charcuterie and the vegetables are as healthy as can be when you slide through Bronxpark East  with your Toyota come to Tihama.

Best Yemeni food in USA
I like mandi meat , madfoon meat is so delicious and I like the fly fish too with Yemeni bread
(Slalad and soup is free)
Hidden gem! Amazing food and service. Very unique flavors and everything home made. Loved the Yemeni bread and complimentary tea. Definitely worth the trip and will be back.
Authentic Yemeni food and excellent service. High recommended!
Food was so good . Specially their signature yemeni bread. Highly recommended

Ordered through uber, foods was so over salted it was actually offensive mind you I actually enjoy savory foods. Bread dough wasnâ€™t fully cooked, Fish sahlta came with a literal inch of oil sitting on top. I was shocked when I saw the reviews on google were actually good. We threw everything out after taking a bite of each things. Haram to waste food but it was a literal health hazard to consume at this point.

Wow really good food! Definitely a basic restaurant in terms of tables and chairs and decor, but the food is so delicious and the service is great. The fresh soft bread is huge and so yummy and only like $3. We got the Mandy Lamb with rice which was excellent, and the hummus. The tea is black and sweet and the music was beautiful! Definitely will return. Definitely recommend. Decent prices too. Oh and the soup and salad were both delish! Like a curry chicken broth and tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce and a good sauce.

while waiting for my order the person on the next table said something I signaled to my eyes the I was latin and was watching curious he invited me to his meal I believe is fulah he told me
is lamb served with a pita like big bread wow loved it ...and also loved the soup as a entree
Super fresh Yemeni food. Food came out quickly and service was friendly

Incredibly good food. Very warm service. It seems like we were given free salad and soup-- both quite good.

Portions are really big and meant to be family style.

The food was delicious. I've tried a few other Yemeni restaurants in other areas and this was my favorite Yemeni restaurant that I've ever tried. The food was excellent, from the soup and salad to the various lamb dishes to the giant bread. The servers were very attentive and gave good service. The place is a small place on a quiet block. It's nothing fancy but the food is good, so I'll be going back again.

Food it is ok

The food, i guess, is alright, but the portion is way less than any other restaurant in the neighborhood for the price.
If you go to any Yemeni restaurant, they don't charge you tax on the food if you are paying with cash, but this one it does. They still charge you. Also, the cashier lady is very rude and unprofessional. And no matter how much you spend on food, you still get only one Yemeni soup even if you have a couple of orders of mandi.
This is not the way you treat customers
especially when a lot of competition is around you.

2 star for the Yemeni fish , the rice and chicken we was asking for kind of plate called ( chicken kabsa ) what we get!! totally different
-Customer service 1 star
Went there today for the first time and the food was amazing, the prices are good too! Would highly recommend eating there !
great food and hospitality
